plan_metadata.name: COMPETE ADVANCED
plan_metadata.target_athlete: Advanced racer, competitive performance goal, sophisticated training capacity
plan_metadata.goal: Podium-level performance through sequential limiter-focused training blocks

workouts.name: W01 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Welcome to advanced Block Periodization for podium contention. Unlike traditional periodization (building everything simultaneously), block periodization concentrates training stress on ONE system at a time in 2-4 week blocks. This creates deeper adaptation in each system sequentially. Week 1: comprehensive testing to identify YOUR primary limiter. Weeks 2-5: concentrated loading on biggest limiter (Block 1). Weeks 6-7: recovery/transmutation. Weeks 8-10: sharpening block (Block 2). Weeks 11-12: taper/race. This requires discipline—you'll temporarily neglect some capacities to overload others. Advanced athletes understand this trade-off delivers superior results.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Comprehensive assessment week. Tuesday has complete power profiling (FTP + 5-min + 3-min + 1-min efforts). Thursday has threshold endurance + repeatability test. Saturday has durability assessment ride (5-6 hours with sustained efforts). This week determines which block you follow in Weeks 2-5: VO2max, Threshold, Durability, or Neuromuscular.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W01 Tue - FTP + Power Profile Testing
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
30 min warmup → 5 min all-out → 10 min recovery → 20 min max effort → 15 min easy → 3 min all-out → 15 min easy → 1 min all-out → 10 min cooldown

• Comprehensive power profile. FTP (20-min × 0.95). Then maximal efforts at multiple durations: 5-min (VO2max power), 3-min (anaerobic capacity), 1-min (neuromuscular power). Record everything. Compare to normative data: 5-min should be ~120% FTP, 1-min ~150%+ FTP. Deficiencies reveal limiters. If 5-min <118% = VO2max limiter. If 1-min <145% = neuromuscular limiter.

<Warmup Duration="1800" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="300" Power="1.20"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="600" Power="0.55"/>

workouts.name: W01 Thu - Threshold Endurance + Repeatability Test
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
30 min warmup → 3x15 min @ 100-105% FTP (7 min easy between) → 30 min cooldown

• Can you hold race pace for 45 cumulative minutes? Monitor power consistency—if drop >5% across intervals = threshold endurance limiter. Monitor HR response—excessive drift (>8 bpm) = aerobic efficiency limiter. Record RPE—if effort feels unsustainably hard = threshold limiter.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences—interval 1 high cadence (100+ rpm), interval 2 low cadence (40-60 rpm), interval 3 self-selected.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1800" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="900" OnPower="1.02" Cadence="100" OffDuration="420" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="1800" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W01 Sat - Durability Assessment Ride
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
First 2.5 hours Z2 → 4x20 min @ 85-95% FTP (varied, 8 min easy between) in hours 3-5 → Final 60 min Z2

• Durability baseline. How do sustained efforts feel deep into long ride? Power stable + RPE manageable = good durability. Power fading >5% or RPE spiking = durability limiter. Can you fuel properly? GI distress = fueling limiter. Eat 70-80g carbs/hour, take detailed notes on power decay, RPE drift, fueling tolerance.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences on efforts.

    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

VO2max.name: W02 Mon - Rest VO2MAX BLOCK
VO2max.description:
• Weeks 2-5 are your first concentrated loading block targeting YOUR biggest limiter. This is HARD—you're intentionally overloading one physiological system while maintaining (not improving) others. By end of Week 5, you should feel system-specific fatigue. That's the adaptation stimulus. VO2max block selected.

• WEEK PREVIEW: VO2max concentrated loading. Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday have VO2max sessions. Everything else easy. This is peak VO2max stimulus—lungs will burn, legs will scream. That's adaptation.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.
VO2max.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

VO2max.name: W02 Tue - VO2max Session #1
VO2max.description:
• STRUCTURE:
30 min warmup → 6x5 min @ 110-120% FTP (5 min easy between) → 30 min cooldown

• Classic VO2max intervals. Target 110-120% FTP. Should reach 95%+ max HR by end of each. Full recovery between intervals mandatory—don't cheat rest periods.

• CADENCE WORK: Alternate high cadence (100+ rpm seated) and low cadence (40-60 rpm seated, big gear) on intervals.

<Warmup Duration="1800" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="6" OnDuration="300" OnPower="1.15" Cadence="100" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="1800" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

VO2max.name: W02 Thu - VO2max Session #2
VO2max.description:
• STRUCTURE:
30 min warmup → 8x4 min @ 110-120% FTP (4 min easy between) → 30 min cooldown

• Different interval duration, same system stress. Shorter intervals allow slightly higher power. Building VO2max capacity through accumulated time at max oxygen uptake.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences—intervals 1, 3, 5, 7 at high cadence (100+ rpm), intervals 2, 4, 6, 8 at low cadence (40-60 rpm).

• Maximum 15-second efforts. Focus on peak power, not endurance. Full recovery between efforts. This trains neuromuscular recruitment, not energy systems.

• CADENCE WORK: High cadence (100+ rpm) on all sprints.

VO2max.name: W03 Mon - Rest VO2MAX BLOCK

• WEEK PREVIEW: Peak VO2max volume week. Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday have VO2max sessions. Everything else easy. This is maximum VO2max stimulus—you're intentionally overloading this system.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.

Threshold.name: W03 Mon - Rest THRESHOLD BLOCK
Threshold.description:
• Week 3 is peak volume of Block 1. You're deep into concentrated threshold loading. By Saturday you should feel threshold-specific fatigue—race pace feels harder, sustained efforts burn faster. That's adaptation working. Week 4 continues loading, Week 5 tapers slightly before recovery.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Peak threshold volume week. Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday have threshold sessions. Everything else easy. This is maximum threshold stimulus—you're intentionally overloading this system.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.
Threshold.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

Threshold.name: W03 Tue - Threshold Session #1
Threshold.description:
• STRUCTURE:
30 min warmup → 3x20 min @ 100-105% FTP (10 min easy between) → 30 min cooldown

• Peak volume—three 20-minute blocks. 60 minutes total at threshold. This is HARD. Break 20-minute blocks into 4x5 mentally. Stay smooth, controlled breathing, steady power.

• CADENCE WORK: Alternate high cadence (100+ rpm seated) and low cadence (40-60 rpm seated, big gear) on intervals.
Threshold.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1800" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="1200" OnPower="1.025" Cadence="100" OffDuration="600" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="1800" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

Threshold.name: W03 Wed - Easy Endurance
Threshold.description: • Easy day. Recovery between threshold sessions.
Threshold.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="7200" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

Threshold.name: W03 Thu - Threshold Session #2
Threshold.description:
• STRUCTURE:
30 min warmup → 2x30 min @ 100-105% FTP (10 min easy between) → 30 min cooldown

• Peak volume—two 30-minute blocks. 60 minutes total at threshold. Can you extend interval duration while maintaining power? This builds race pace endurance.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences—interval 1 high cadence (100+ rpm), interval 2 low cadence (40-60 rpm).
Threshold.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1800" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="2" OnDuration="1800" OnPower="1.025" Cadence="100" OffDuration="600" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="1800" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

Threshold.name: W03 Fri - Easy Endurance
Threshold.description:
• Easy day. Building volume without intensity.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.
Threshold.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

Threshold.name: W03 Sat - Threshold Session #3
Threshold.description:
• STRUCTURE:
30 min warmup → 4x20 min @ 100-105% FTP (8 min easy between) → 30 min cooldown

• Third threshold session. Four 20-minute blocks. 80 minutes total at threshold. This is peak threshold volume. Building repeatability—can you hold threshold multiple times when fatigued?

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences—intervals 1, 3 at high cadence (100+ rpm), intervals 2, 4 at low cadence (40-60 rpm).
Threshold.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1800" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="4" OnDuration="1200" OnPower="1.025" Cadence="100" OffDuration="480" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="1800" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

Threshold.name: W03 Sun - Long Easy Endurance (Maintenance)
Threshold.description: • Long easy ride maintains aerobic base while body recovers from threshold loading. Conversational pace. Eat 70-80g carbs/hour. This is maintenance volume, not training stress.
Threshold.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="14400" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

Durability.name: W03 Mon - Rest DURABILITY BLOCK
Durability.description:
• Week 3 is peak volume of Block 1. You're deep into concentrated durability loading. By Saturday you should feel durability-specific fatigue—power fades faster in final hours, sustained efforts feel harder when tired. That's adaptation working. Week 4 continues loading, Week 5 tapers slightly before recovery.

• WEEK PREVIEW: Peak durability volume week. Tuesday, Thursday, Saturday have durability sessions. Everything else easy. This is maximum durability stimulus—you're intentionally overloading this system.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.
Durability.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

Durability.name: W03 Tue - Durability Session #1
Durability.description:
• STRUCTURE:
30 min warmup → 3 hours Z2 → 4x20 min @ 87-92% FTP (G-Spot, 8 min easy between) → Final hour Z2 → 30 min cooldown

• Peak durability volume. G-Spot efforts deep into long ride. 80 minutes total at G-Spot when fatigued. This builds race-specific durability. Monitor power stability—should maintain power across all intervals.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences on G-Spot efforts—some high cadence (100+ rpm), some low cadence (40-60 rpm).
Durability.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="600" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.65"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="10800" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="4" OnDuration="1200" OnPower="0.895" Cadence="100" OffDuration="480" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <SteadyState Duration="3600" Power="0.70" Cadence="85"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="1800" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

• Peak durability volume. G-Spot efforts deep into long ride. 75 minutes total at G-Spot when fatigued. Building repeatability—can you hold G-Spot multiple times when tired?

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences on G-Spot efforts—intervals 1, 3, 5 at high cadence (100+ rpm), intervals 2, 4 at low cadence (40-60 rpm).

workouts.name: W06 Mon - Rest
workouts.description:
• Recovery week after Block 1. Your body adapts during rest, not during work. By Friday you should feel fresh and strong. This is when Weeks 2-5 concentrated loading converts into performance gains. If you're still tired by Sunday, you pushed too hard in Block 1 or need to address recovery habits (sleep, nutrition, stress).

• WEEK PREVIEW: Recovery week. Tuesday has light quality touch. Thursday is easy endurance. Saturday is moderate endurance with light tempo. This is when training stress converts to performance.

• REST DAY NOTE: Fine to ride if you really want, but no longer than an hour and don't break 30 TSS.
workouts.blocks: <FreeRide Duration="60"/>

workouts.name: W06 Tue - Light Quality Touch
workouts.description:
• STRUCTURE:
20 min warmup → 3x8 min @ 85-90% FTP (5 min easy between) → 15 min cooldown

• Light quality maintains fitness without adding fatigue. Should feel controlled and relatively comfortable. This is maintenance work, not training stress.

• CADENCE WORK: Mix cadences—interval 1 high cadence (100+ rpm), interval 2 low cadence (40-60 rpm), interval 3 self-selected.
workouts.blocks:
<Warmup Duration="1200" PowerLow="0.50" PowerHigh="0.75"/>
    <IntervalsT Repeat="3" OnDuration="480" OnPower="0.875" Cadence="100" OffDuration="300" OffPower="0.55"/>
    <Cooldown Duration="900" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.50"/>

    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

• CADENCE: Self-selected (85-95 rpm).

    <Cooldown Duration="600" PowerLow="0.70" PowerHigh="0.55"/>

• No real intensity stress. Light tempo maintains fitness. This should feel comfortable. Check bike—make sure everything works.

block_periodization.description: Concentrated loading on ONE system at a time in 2-4 week blocks

cadence_work.base_period: High cadence (100+ rpm seated) and low cadence/torque (40-60 rpm seated, big gear) on all intervals
cadence_work.build_period: Mix high/low cadence + rhythm intervals (2 min Z3 + 1 min Z4 patterns) + loaded intervals (1 min Z5/Z6 → settle into Z3)
cadence_work.description: Teaches power production in different ways, foundation for changing pace

rhythm_intervals.description: Alternating patterns: 2 min Z3 (self-selected cadence) + 1 min Z4 (high cadence 100+ rpm) x 4-6, continuous

loaded_intervals.description: 1 min Z5/Z6 (high cadence, seated) → settle into 11-19 min Z3 (self-selected cadence). Simulates race starts and surges.

strength_training.note: Athlete performs own strength program. Suggested on lighter training days.

monday_week_preview.description: Monday rest days include week preview with key workouts, block periodization reminders, and competitive performance guidance
